item.title: Creating a Data Enabled API in 10 Minutes with MongoDB Stitch
item.description: Introduction Creating an API that exposes data doesn’t have to be complicated. With MongoDB Stitch, you can create a data enabled endpoint in about 10 minutes or less. At the heart of the entire process is MongoDB Stitch’s Services. There are several from which to choose and to create a data enabled endpoint, you’ll choose the HTTP Service with a Webhook. When you create an HTTP Service, you’re enabling access to this service from Stitch’s serverless functions in the form of an object called context.
